citations.narrative:
On 4/23/2023 veterinary staff identified a guinea pig with suboptimal body condition and pathological fractures. On
4/26/2023 veterinary staff identified another guinea pig displaying the same clinical signs. An investigation revealed that
the guinea pigs had not been receiving species-specific food leading to hypovitaminosis C in the animals. Guinea pigs
require supplementation of vitamin C within their diets to maintain normal metabolism, commercial laboratory diets are
formulated to meet this requirement. Guinea pig feed must be of sufficient quantity and nutritive value to meet the normal
daily requirements for the condition and size of the guinea pig. Corrective actions had been put in place at the time of this
inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
